subServices.content:
Non-Surgical Rhinoplasty (Nose Filler)

The reason I emphasize the term non-surgical rhinoplasty is because this expression is frequently misused online. Non-surgical methods are not alternatives to rhinoplasty (nose aesthetic) surgery. They are essentially filler applications that aim to approach aesthetic proportions by creating small, temporary (approximately 8-12 months) changes in the nose.

Structural problems requiring surgery cannot be corrected with this method. The procedure must be planned and applied by an experienced aesthetic surgeon with advanced anatomical knowledge.

Why is Safety Important in Nose Fillers?

The nose area is a region with extremely dense vascular connections. Especially in areas with strong connective tissue like the nasal tip, skin elasticity is limited; therefore, the risk of complications may be higher compared to other facial areas.

When applied with the correct technique in appropriately selected cases, the procedure is safe; however, incorrect applications can disrupt tissue circulation.

Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgeon Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs non-surgical rhinoplasty (nose filler) procedures by holistically evaluating facial proportions and creating personalized plans.

Which Fillers Are Used? Are They Harmful to the Body?

Hyaluronic acid (HA) based fillers are frequently preferred in non-surgical rhinoplasty:

  • They are tissue-friendly and reversible substances
  • They are absorbed by the body over time; maintaining volume effect in the area for a certain period
  • Allergic reaction rate is low
  • Can be dissolved with hyaluronidase if necessary (reversible)

What Can Be Done with Nose Fillers?

The following minor shape irregularities can be camouflaged without resorting to surgery:

  • Small depressions or asymmetries on the nasal bridge can be balanced by filling the opposite side
  • If the nasal starting point (nasofrontal angle) is too far back, it can be elevated for harmony with the nasal bridge
  • Small bone protrusions can be camouflaged with appropriate filler planning; the profile appears straighter
  • If the nasal tip is drooping, a more elevated appearance can be given with limited volume support

Note: The rules of these procedures are not standard; every face is different. Therefore, every application should be planned individually.

Advantages and Limitations

Advantages:

  • Non-surgical; short procedure time (approximately 15-20 minutes)
  • Quick return to social life
  • Reversible (can be dissolved if necessary)

Limitations:

  • Permanence is temporary (approximately 8-12 months)
  • Surgery (rhinoplasty) is required for structural curvatures, breathing problems, or significant deformities
  • Should only be applied by a specialist physician due to high vascular density in the area

Conclusion

Non-surgical rhinoplasty (nose filler) is a suitable option for selected patients who do not want surgery and seek small, temporary adjustments. It should not be forgotten that rhinoplasty may be necessary for solving structural problems.

Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgeon Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs non-surgical nose filler and rhinoplasty applications in his clinic in Antalya, Turkey, in accordance with modern surgical principles and in a personalized manner.

subServices.content:
PRIMARY RHINOPLASTY (NOSE AESTHETICS)

Rhinoplasty comes from Greek and means "to shape the nose." Today, it is used to describe aesthetic surgeries performed on the nose. The main purpose of these surgeries is to obtain a nose that is proportional to the face, natural and aesthetic.

Primary rhinoplasty is the first nose aesthetic procedure performed on patients who have not had any previous surgical intervention on the nose.

WHAT IS A BEAUTIFUL NOSE?

A beautiful nose is one that is compatible with the general structure of the face, balanced, and provides aesthetic integrity without drawing attention.

The main elements that make a nose look beautiful are:

  • Symmetry: It is the basic indicator of a healthy and balanced appearance.
  • Balance and Proportion: The nose should be compatible with other areas of the face (a small nose for a small face, a more proportional nose for a wider face).
  • Naturalness: It should give a young, elegant and lively expression without distorting the character of the face.
  • Aesthetic Compatibility: It should integrate with the person's facial features and emphasize beauty without drawing attention.
  • Cultural Harmony: Natural harmony should be achieved by considering each individual's genetic and cultural characteristics.

The concept of beauty varies from person to person, from culture to culture. Therefore, a successful rhinoplasty should be planned not only according to certain ratios, but also according to the person's facial anatomy, skin structure and expectations.

AESTHETIC UNDERSTANDING AND SCIENTIFIC BALANCE

Many ratios and angles for the "ideal nose" have been defined in the plastic surgery literature. However, for an experienced surgeon, these ratios are only a guide.

During surgery, each patient's facial structure, bone and cartilage characteristics, skin thickness and ethnic structure are evaluated and a unique planning is made.

A successful nose aesthetic is the combination of scientific knowledge and artistic perspective.

Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı aims to achieve natural, functional and aesthetic results by analyzing each patient's facial ratios in detail in his clinic in Antalya.

PATIENT EXPECTATIONS AND PLANNING

Almost all people who want to have nose aesthetics are dissatisfied with a specific feature of their nose. This could be:

  • Nasal hump,
  • Size of the nose,
  • Drooping nasal tip,
  • Base width or asymmetry.

The most important stage in primary rhinoplasty planning is to understand the patient's complaints and combine them with the surgeon's aesthetic perspective.

Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı analyzes the patient's face and nose in digital environment during examination and shows the patient the possible post-operative appearance with simulation method.

This process ensures strong communication between the patient and the surgeon. Planning is the determining factor in the success of rhinoplasty surgery.

OPERATION (OPEN AND CLOSED TECHNIQUES)

Nose aesthetic surgeries can be applied with closed or open technique. Both methods have advantages and reasons for preference.

Open Rhinoplasty

A small incision is made at the bottom of the nose and the nasal skin is lifted. This allows the surgeon to see the nasal structures directly and intervene in a more controlled manner.

This method is especially preferred in patients with serious structural curvatures, secondary or tertiary surgeries.

The location of the incision usually becomes completely faint within a year.

Closed Rhinoplasty

The incision is made inside the nose, leaving no external scar.

All interventions that can be done with open technique can also be applied with closed technique.

Surgery time may be slightly longer in patients with serious structural problems.

Which surgery technique will be chosen is determined together with the patient during the preliminary interview at the office of Aesthetic, Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery Specialist Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı in Antalya.

Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı frequently uses both surgery techniques.

COMBINING INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL NASAL PROCEDURES

The inside and outside of the nose are a whole. Curvatures inside the nose (septum deviation) usually occur together with external asymmetry.

Therefore, the most correct approach is to perform aesthetic (rhinoplasty) and functional (septoplasty) procedures in the same session.

Cartilage tissues inside the nose are used to support the nasal tip or strengthen the nasal roof when necessary.

If there is not enough cartilage in patients who have had previous nasal surgery, ear or rib cartilage can be used as a second source.

This method improves both breathing function and aesthetic result at the same time.

POSTOPERATIVE PERIOD

  • Mild nausea or chills may occur within the first few hours after surgery.
  • Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı usually prefers not to place tampons inside the nose.
  • If internal curvature has been corrected, special silicone tampons that can stay for 1 day and do not stick to the nose can be used.
  • There are plastic cast and tapes on the nose after surgery. Cold application is done in the first 24 hours.
  • Pain is mild on the first evening and can be controlled with painkillers.
  • Pain is minimal from the 2nd day onwards.
  • Bruising and edema usually decrease within 1 week.
  • Dressings and stitches are removed in the 1st week, the patient can return to social life in the 2nd week.
  • 70% of swelling decreases in the 2nd month, the final nose form settles within 1 year.

CONCLUSION

Primary rhinoplasty (nose aesthetic) not only improves appearance but also provides functionally more comfortable breathing.

The goal of the surgery is to create a nose that is compatible with the person's facial features, natural, elegant and balanced.

Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgeon Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs nose aesthetic operations in his clinic in Antalya in accordance with modern surgical principles and with personalized planning.

subServices.content:
What is Secondary Rhinoplasty?

Secondary rhinoplasty is a term used to describe second correction surgeries performed on patients who have previously undergone nose aesthetics.

Simply put, it is a second or revision nose surgery performed on patients who are not satisfied with the result of the first surgery or who experience functional problems.

These operations not only correct aesthetic appearance; they also include functional goals such as eliminating breathing problems, restoring nasal support and re-establishing facial balance. Tertiary rhinoplasty refers to the third correction surgery performed on patients who have undergone two or more operations.

Why is a Separate Definition Needed?

Secondary or tertiary rhinoplasty operations require much more experience, patience and attention compared to primary rhinoplasty surgeries. The reasons for this are:

  • Tissue adhesions due to previous surgery make it difficult to clarify anatomical plans.
  • Since the nasal skin has thinned in the previous surgery, it can make irregularities in the underlying cartilage or bone more noticeable.
  • Collapse or loss of support in the nasal bridge may occur after excessive cartilage removal.
  • Hole (perforation) may occur in the internal nasal tissue due to mucosal and cartilage damage.
  • Since the previous surgery was performed by a different surgeon, the techniques and graft information used may not be fully known.
  • Therefore, the surgery time is longer and surgical planning must be more detailed.

Techniques Used in Secondary Rhinoplasty Surgery

The aim in these surgeries is to restore structure and support to the nose. In most cases, it is necessary to take grafts from another part of the body to replace cartilage or bone tissues that were removed in the previous surgery.

Ear Cartilage

(Conchal cartilage): Ideal for nasal tip support due to its flexible structure.

Rib Cartilage

(Costal cartilage): Provides strong support in advanced deformities.

Fascia

(Muscle sheath): Used to soften superficial irregularities and provide natural contour.

Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı states that approximately 90% of secondary rhinoplasty cases require graft need in his clinical experiences.

Thanks to these grafts, collapses in the nasal structure are eliminated, nasal support is restored and natural aesthetic lines are created.

Surgery Process

  • Secondary rhinoplasty is usually performed with open technique.
  • This method provides the surgeon with a wider field of view and allows careful separation of adhesions left by the previous surgery.
  • Surgery time varies between 3 to 5 hours.
  • Cast and tapes are placed on the nose at the end of the surgery.
  • If comprehensive correction has been made in the internal nasal structure, silicone tampons can be used; otherwise, tampons are usually not placed.

Postoperative Period

The postoperative process is similar to primary rhinoplasty, but the healing process may be slightly longer due to previously operated tissues.

  • Edema and bruising may occur in the first 24 hours.
  • Cold application and keeping the head elevated support the reduction of edema.
  • Cast and tapes are removed in the 1st week.
  • The patient can return to daily activities from the 2nd week onwards.
  • The final nose shape completely settles within 12-18 months.

Conclusion

Secondary and tertiary rhinoplasty are one of the most challenging but most satisfying surgical procedures in the field of nose aesthetics. The aim is not only an aesthetic appearance but also functional and psychological recovery.

Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgeon Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs secondary and tertiary rhinoplasty surgeries in his clinic in Antalya in accordance with modern surgical principles and with personalized planning.

seo.title: What is Septum Deviation (Nasal Curvature)? | Septoplasty and Nose Aesthetics | Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı Antalya
seo.description: Septum deviation (nasal curvature) can cause shortness of breath and disorder in nose aesthetics. In Antalya, Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgeon Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı safely performs septoplasty and rhinoplasty surgeries in the same session.

subServices.content:
What is Septum Deviation?

The septum is the structure that separates the right and left air channels of the nose in the middle. Its front part is cartilage, while its back part consists of bone tissue. A healthy septum should be located exactly in the midline and provide equal airflow to both nostrils.

The bending of the septum to one side is called septum deviation (nasal curvature). This condition causes reduced airflow or complete blockage on the side where the curvature is located. As a result, complaints such as breathing difficulty, nasal congestion, snoring and sinusitis tendency may occur.

Why Does Septum Deviation Occur?

Septum deviation usually occurs due to traumas experienced in childhood, nasal fractures or congenital developmental disorders. In some cases, cartilage development may develop curved spontaneously without any external cause.

Not every curvature requires surgery. What is important is whether this curvature causes functional problems in the patient such as shortness of breath, headache or recurrent sinusitis.

If these complaints are present, surgical correction (septoplasty) is necessary.

Can Septoplasty and Nose Aesthetics Be Performed Together?

The nose is a whole in terms of both facial aesthetics and respiratory function. Therefore, curvatures in the nasal cartilage usually cause shape disorders in the external nose appearance. In these cases, it is ideal to perform septum deviation surgery (septoplasty) and nose aesthetics (rhinoplasty) operation in the same session.

Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı always considers the functional structure in nose aesthetic planning.

In patients who have had septoplasty before and whose cartilage tissue has been removed after surgery, rhinoplasty operation may become more complex. Because septum cartilage is necessary for shaping the nasal tip, supporting the bridge and providing a natural appearance.

If these cartilages have been removed, cartilage graft may need to be taken from the ear or rib.

Therefore, in patients with both breathing problems and aesthetic concerns, performing septoplasty and rhinoplasty surgeries in the same session provides healthier and more permanent results.

What is Concha and What Does It Do?

Concha are anatomical structures located inside the nasal cavity and extending on the side wall of the nose, resembling a radiator. During breathing, these structures heat, humidify and filter the air.

In some people, concha may be larger than normal. This condition is called concha hypertrophy and can make breathing difficult.

If concha size causes breathing problems, concha reduction procedure can also be applied during nose aesthetics (rhinoplasty).

This way, the patient both breathes more comfortably and obtains an aesthetically balanced nose.

Conclusion

Septum deviation is not only a breathing problem but also a condition that affects nose aesthetics. In patients experiencing nasal curvature and congestion, performing septoplasty and rhinoplasty operations together is the most correct approach both functionally and aesthetically.

Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgeon Op. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs septum deviation, septoplasty and nose aesthetic surgeries in his clinic in Antalya with modern surgical principles, providing both natural appearance and healthy breathing together.

subServices.content:
Breast asymmetry is a common finding in women and, in most cases, is considered normal. Since complete breast symmetry is rarely achievable, differences in size, shape, or position are frequently observed. Minor breast asymmetries usually go unnoticed, while pronounced cases may require consideration of breast asymmetry surgery.

How Is the Degree of Breast Asymmetry Evaluated?

There is no universal measurement standard for breast asymmetry. The decision for surgery depends largely on the patient's expectations and complaints. Very mild asymmetries are generally not recommended for surgery, as unnecessary correction attempts may result in suboptimal outcomes.

Will There Be Scars After Breast Asymmetry Surgery?

Breast asymmetry correction surgery typically involves reducing the larger breast or augmenting the smaller one, sometimes with the use of silicone breast implants. After surgery, a fine vertical scar extending from the areola may remain. The visibility of this scar depends on the surgical technique, skin characteristics, and the healing process.

Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs breast asymmetry surgeries in Antalya, Turkey, adhering to contemporary surgical standards and ensuring safe outcomes.

subServices.content:
What Is Breast Augmentation?

Breast augmentation surgery is most commonly performed by placing silicone implants either under the breast tissue or beneath the chest muscle. It is recommended for women with naturally small breasts, loss of breast volume after pregnancy and breastfeeding, or decreased breast size following significant weight loss.

Results of Breast Augmentation

  • Fuller and firmer breasts
  • Improved body proportions
  • Enhanced self-confidence and body image

Breast Augmentation in Cases of Sagging

When significant breast ptosis (sagging) is present, breast implants alone are not sufficient. In such cases, breast augmentation should be combined with a breast lift (mastopexy). This approach both increases breast volume and repositions the nipple to a higher, natural level.

Incisions and Scars in Breast Augmentation

Breast augmentation is not a scar-free procedure. However, incisions are placed in less visible areas, and efforts are made to keep them as short as possible.

Types of Breast Implants and Surgical Process

Breast implants are categorized by filling material into saline-filled and silicone gel-filled types. By shape, they include round and anatomical (teardrop) implants. Before surgery, smoking should be stopped, blood-thinning medications discontinued, and a protein-rich diet is recommended. The surgery is performed under general anesthesia and typically lasts 1.5-2 hours, with implant placement determined according to the patient's anatomy.

Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs breast augmentation surgeries in Antalya, Turkey, following modern surgical principles and up-to-date approaches.

subServices.content:
What Is Breast Augmentation with Lift?

Breast augmentation with lift is a combined procedure for patients who experience both loss of breast volume and sagging. While silicone implants restore fullness, mastopexy (breast lift) is performed at the same time to achieve an aesthetically pleasing and natural result.

Who Is It For?

  • Women with volume loss and sagging after pregnancy and breastfeeding
  • Patients with breast deformity after weight loss
  • Women with age-related breast sagging and volume reduction
  • Patients who desire both fuller and lifted breasts

Preoperative Consultation and Planning

A successful breast augmentation with lift starts with a detailed preoperative consultation. At the private clinic of Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgery Specialist Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı in Antalya, Turkey, the patient's breast structure, skin thickness, nipple position, degree of sagging, and expectations are carefully evaluated.

How Is the Surgery Performed?

The surgery is performed under general anesthesia and lasts about 2-3 hours. First, silicone implants are placed to restore volume. Then, breast tissue is reshaped and the nipple is repositioned higher to complete the lift. Incision options depend on sagging severity.

Scars After Surgery

Scars are inevitable after breast augmentation with lift, but their visibility depends on each patient's healing process. Since incisions are placed around the areola, vertically downwards, and along the inframammary fold, they are usually well camouflaged and tend to fade within 6-12 months.

Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs breast augmentation and Lift surgeries in Antalya, Turkey, in line with modern surgical principles.

seo.description: For patients with sufficient breast tissue, breast lift surgery can be performed without implants. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı offers natural-looking mastopexy procedures in Antalya, Turkey, following modern surgical principles.

subServices.content:
What Is a Breast Lift Without Implants?

Mastopexy, or breast lift, is a surgical procedure to correct sagging breasts. While some patients require implants due to volume loss, women who have sufficient breast tissue and are satisfied with their breast size may undergo breast lift without implants. In this case, the nipple and breast tissue are repositioned higher, excess skin is removed, and the natural breast tissue is reshaped to achieve a lifted and more youthful appearance.

Who Is It For?

  • Women satisfied with their breast size but wanting correction of sagging
  • Patients with sagging after pregnancy and breastfeeding but preserved volume
  • Women with sufficient breast tissue despite sagging after weight loss
  • Those seeking a natural result without implants
  • Women experiencing age-related breast sagging without significant volume loss

Preoperative Evaluation

Before mastopexy, a detailed consultation is essential. At the private clinic of Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgery Specialist Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı in Antalya, Turkey, breast tissue volume, skin elasticity, nipple position, and the degree of sagging are carefully evaluated.

Based on this consultation, a personalized surgical plan is prepared to lift the breasts naturally without the need for implants. The appropriate surgical technique is determined according to the degree of breast ptosis.

How Is the Surgery Performed?

Breast lift without implants is performed under general anesthesia and takes about 2-3 hours.

  • Central pedicle technique: The nipple-areola complex is repositioned upward on a central pedicle, preserving blood supply and sensation.
  • T-shaped incision (anchor incision): Incisions are made around the areola, vertically down, and along the inframammary fold. This method provides reliable and long-lasting results in cases of significant sagging.
  • Tissue reshaping: Excess skin is removed, and the breast tissue is reshaped to achieve a lifted, natural form.

Scars After Surgery

Scarring is unavoidable in mastopexy. The T-shaped incision leaves scars around the areola, vertically downwards, and along the inframammary fold. The visibility of scars depends on individual healing capacity; in most cases, they fade and blend with surrounding skin within 6-12 months.

Special creams and silicone gel sheets are recommended for postoperative scar care to promote faster healing.

Recovery Process

  • First days: Swelling and tightness are normal. Pain usually decreases significantly after day 3.
  • First week: A surgical bra is worn. Light walking is allowed, but strenuous arm movements should be avoided.
  • 2-3 weeks: Most patients return to daily life and work, avoiding heavy activity.
  • 4-6 weeks: Breast tissue adapts to its new position, scars begin to fade.
  • After 6 weeks: Sports and intensive physical activities can be resumed.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is breast lift without implants permanent?

Yes, breast lift without implants provides long-lasting results. However, factors like aging, weight fluctuations, and gravity may cause some sagging over time.

Can I breastfeed after surgery?

The central pedicle technique preserves most milk ducts. However, breastfeeding capacity may vary depending on the preoperative condition.

When will I see my final results?

It may take 3-6 months for breasts to settle into their final shape and for swelling to completely resolve. Scar maturation can take up to 1 year.

Breast Lift in Antalya, Turkey

A breast lift without implants is an excellent option for patients who are satisfied with their breast size and only want correction of sagging. Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs breast lift surgeries without implants in Antalya, Turkey, in line with modern surgical principles.

Personalized treatment plans are created through detailed preoperative evaluation and understanding of patient expectations.

subServices.content:
What Is Breast Reduction?

Large breasts are not only an aesthetic concern but also a significant health issue. Carrying heavy breast tissue for years may cause neck, back, and shoulder pain, spinal deformities, and deep shoulder grooves from bra straps. In summer, rashes, fungal infections, and unpleasant odor under the breasts are common.

Breast reduction surgery is performed under general anesthesia by removing excess breast tissue and skin, and repositioning the nipple higher. This reduces breast size, provides relief, and creates a more proportionate body shape.

Preoperative Consultation

The success of breast reduction surgery depends on detailed preoperative planning. At the private clinic of Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgery Specialist Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı in Antalya, Turkey, a thorough consultation is carried out.

During this evaluation, the patient's overall health, smoking status, medications, and previous surgeries are considered. Expectations are discussed in detail to ensure realistic outcomes.

Surgical Techniques

Different techniques can be used in breast reduction surgery. The most commonly used techniques include:

  • T (Anchor) Incision Technique: The classic and most frequently used method. It consists of an incision around the areola, a vertical line from the areola to the inframammary fold, and a horizontal line along the inframammary fold.
  • Vertical Incision Technique: This technique leaves a shorter scar as it eliminates the horizontal incision in the inframammary fold. Only the areola and vertical line incisions remain.
  • J-Incision or L-Incision Technique: These techniques are used for mild to moderate breast enlargement and leave shorter scars.

Scars After Surgery

Scarring is inevitable after breast reduction surgery, but their visibility varies according to each patient's healing process. Scars are located around the areola, vertically downwards, and in the inframammary fold. They are red and visible in the first months. Within 6-12 months, scars usually fade and blend with the skin tone.

Silicone gel, scar creams, and sun protection are recommended to promote faster healing and less noticeable scars.

Recovery Process

  • First 24-48 hours: You'll be monitored in the hospital. Pain relief is provided with medications.
  • First week: A special surgical bra is worn. Sutures are usually removed within 1-2 weeks.
  • 2-4 weeks: Return to daily activities begins. Heavy lifting should be avoided.
  • 6 weeks: Light exercises can be started.
  • 3-6 months: Breasts settle into their final shape, scars begin to fade.

Breastfeeding and Pregnancy

After breast reduction, milk production may decrease, but most women can still breastfeed. If planned after pregnancy, it is recommended to wait at least 6 months after breastfeeding ends.

During surgery, some milk ducts connected to the nipple are preserved, which increases the likelihood of breastfeeding. However, breastfeeding capacity may vary depending on the surgical technique and breast structure before surgery.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is breast reduction surgery painful?

Since the surgery is performed under general anesthesia, there is no pain during the procedure. Mild to moderate pain may occur in the first few days after surgery, but this can be controlled with pain medication.

When can I return to work after surgery?

Patients with office jobs can usually return to work within 1-2 weeks. For jobs requiring physical strength, this period may extend to 4-6 weeks.

Is breast reduction a weight loss method?

subServices.content:
Deep Plane Facelift

The deep plane facelift is an advanced surgical technique that goes beyond traditional facelift procedures. Instead of simply pulling and tightening the skin, it targets the supportive tissues beneath the skin. The SMAS layer, malar fat pads, and ligaments are released and lifted together with the cheeks, jawline, and neck deep tissues.

Signs of Facial Aging

As age progresses, the face loses its youthful dynamic triangular form:

  • Cheeks descend due to gravity, reducing cheekbone prominence
  • Nasolabial folds deepen
  • Jawline becomes undefined, with sagging 'jowls' appearing on the sides
  • In the neck, platysma muscle laxity causes vertical bands and excess skin
  • Skin elasticity decreases, creating a looser and more wrinkled appearance

Patients often complain of looking tired, sad, or older than they actually are when they look in the mirror.

What is Deep Plane Facelift?

The deep plane facelift is an advanced surgical technique that goes beyond traditional facelift procedures. Instead of simply pulling and tightening the skin, it targets the supportive tissues beneath:

  • SMAS layer (Superficial Musculoaponeurotic System): The muscle and fascial layer that supports the cheeks and jawline.
  • Malar fat pads: Soft tissues over the cheekbones that descend with time, creating a sagging appearance.
  • Ligaments (facial ligaments): Structures that anchor the cheeks, jawline, and neck muscles to the bone.

In deep plane facelift, these ligaments (zygomatic, masseteric, mandibular, and platysma ligaments) are released. Thus, the cheeks, jawline, and neck are lifted together with deep tissues. The result is a natural, long-lasting facial appearance with restored youthful volume.

Classic Facelift Techniques vs. Deep Plane Difference

Techniques applied in classic facelift surgeries:

  • Skin Only Facelift: Only excess skin is removed and tightened. The face appears tighter in the early period, but due to the elastic nature of the skin, sagging recurs quickly. Rarely preferred alone today.
  • SMAS Plication: After the skin is lifted, sutures are placed on the superficial muscle layer called SMAS to tighten it. Provides longer-lasting results than skin-only method. However, since the SMAS layer is not repositioned, tension may decrease over time.
  • SMASectomy: A portion of the SMAS layer is cut out and removed, and the remaining parts are sutured together to create tension. A stronger effect is achieved, but this technique is limited in lifting cheek volume.
  • Deep Plane Facelift: A deeper and thicker tissue layer is elevated. This way, skin circulation in front of the ear is better preserved and scars heal much healthier. Since all tension is loaded on the SMAS layer, excessive stress is not placed on the skin incision line; this prevents scars from widening and keeps them finer. Since facial volume is lifted upward, the need for additional filler or fat injection is reduced. The result is a natural, long-lasting, and balanced facial appearance.

Preoperative Evaluation

Detailed planning is essential for a successful facelift surgery. During the initial consultation at the clinic of Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgery Specialist Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı in Antalya:

  • The current anatomy of the face, skin quality, and aging signs are evaluated.
  • Photos and measurements are taken to create the most suitable surgical planning for the individual.
  • The patient's expectations (defining the jawline, lifting the cheeks, tightening the neck) are discussed in detail.

Where Are Scars Hidden?

  • Incisions made in deep plane facelift surgery are hidden in the natural folds in front of and behind the ear, and along the hairline.
  • They may be red and noticeable in the first months.
  • Within 6-12 months, their color lightens and blends with the skin tone.
  • Since circulation is better preserved in the deep plane, the quality of scar healing is significantly better compared to classical methods.

Recovery Process

  • First days: Edema, bruising, and tightness may occur. These usually decrease significantly within 1-2 weeks.
  • 1-2 weeks: Most patients can return to work and social life.
  • 4-6 weeks: Facial tissues adapt to their new position, scars gradually become less visible.
  • 6 months and beyond: Final results become apparent. The face regains its youthful, balanced, and natural appearance.

Conclusion

Deep plane facelift is one of the most advanced facelift methods that targets not only the skin but also the deep supportive tissues of the face.

  • Thanks to safer circulation, scars in front of the ear heal better.
  • Since all tension is carried by the SMAS, incision lines remain finer and do not widen.
  • Results are more natural, longer-lasting, and more aesthetic compared to classical techniques.

Endoscopic Brow Lift Surgery

Aging Signs in the Brow and Forehead Area

With aging, the downward displacement of the brows and forehead area can create a tired, sad, or even angry expression. Drooping brows also press on the upper eyelids, making it appear as if there is excess skin on the eyelids. This condition can make a person look older and more tired than they actually are.

What is Endoscopic Brow Lift?

Endoscopic brow lift is a procedure that lifts the brows and forehead area through small incisions made within the scalp. Large incisions are not made; with the help of an endoscopic camera, the connective tissues under the skin are released and the brows are elevated to their natural position. Thus, facial expression becomes younger, livelier, and more energetic.

This method provides shorter recovery time, less scarring, and more natural results compared to the classic open forehead lift method.

Surgical Technique

  • Several small incisions 1-2 cm long are made within the scalp.
  • Tissues in the forehead and brow area are released with an endoscopic camera.
  • The brows and forehead are moved to their new position and fixed.
  • Since incisions are hidden within the scalp, post-surgery scars are not noticeable.

Preoperative Evaluation

Detailed preliminary consultation is essential for a successful endoscopic brow lift. During the examination at the clinic of Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgery Specialist Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı in Antalya:

  • Brow position and symmetry,
  • Forehead skin quality,
  • Relationship with the upper eyelid,
  • Patient's aesthetic expectations are evaluated in detail.

Based on this information, a personalized surgical plan is prepared.

Post-Surgery Recovery

  • Mild swelling and bruising may occur after surgery; these usually decrease within 1-2 weeks.
  • Return to daily life is possible within 5-7 days.
  • Within 2-3 weeks, the brow and forehead area adapts to their new position and gains a natural appearance.
  • Final results usually become apparent within 2-3 months.

Conclusion

Endoscopic brow lift is a modern solution to the problem of low brows and tired expression. This surgery, performed through small incisions, rejuvenates the overall expression of the face and provides a more lively appearance.

Eyelid Surgery (Blepharoplasty)

Signs of Aging and Eyelids

During the aging process, the eyelids are one of the areas that show the earliest and most noticeable changes on the face.

  • Upper eyelids: Excess skin, muscle laxity, and herniated fat tissue together make the person look tired, sleepy, and older than they are. In advanced cases, the visual field may also be restricted.
  • Lower eyelids: Fat bagging, excess skin, wrinkles, and prominent under-eye hollows cause the person to gain a sad, tired, and aged expression.

These complaints have made eyelid surgery (blepharoplasty) one of the most frequently performed facial rejuvenation surgeries.

Upper Eyelid Surgery

Upper eyelid surgery aims to remove excess skin and correct eyelid form.

Stages of the surgery:

  • Incision is made along the natural fold line.
  • Excess skin is removed.
  • Muscle tissue is strengthened if necessary.
  • Herniated fat tissue is regulated or reduced.

Advantages:

  • Scars are hidden within the natural fold, becoming unnoticeable over time.
  • Visual field opens up, a more vigorous and younger gaze is obtained.

Surgery can usually be performed under local anesthesia in 30-45 minutes.

Lower Eyelid Surgery

The most common problems seen in lower eyelids due to aging:

  • Under-eye bags,
  • Excess skin and wrinkles,
  • Under-eye hollow called tear trough,
  • Eyelid laxity and cheek sagging.

Lower eyelid surgery is performed with different techniques depending on the type and degree of these problems.

Lower Eyelid Surgery Techniques

  1. Transconjunctival Blepharoplasty (Scarless Technique)
    • Incisions are made inside the eyelid.
    • Preferred especially in young patients with only bagging without excess skin.
    • Fat bags are removed or repositioned.
    • No scar remains since there is no external incision.
  2. Transcutaneous Blepharoplasty (Classical Technique)
    • Incisions are made along the lash line.
    • Excess skin and muscle tissue are removed.
    • Fat bags are removed or regulated.
    • Effective in patients with both bagging and excess skin.
    • Scars become unnoticeable over time as they are hidden in the lash line.
  3. Fat Repositioning
    • Fat bags are not completely removed but shifted into the under-eye hollow.
    • Thus, both bagging is corrected and hollow appearance is eliminated.
    • A younger, smoother, and more natural under-eye transition is achieved.
  4. Skin Tightening Combinations
    • In patients with mild excess skin or fine wrinkles, laser or chemical peeling can be performed in addition to blepharoplasty.
    • This method provides a smoother appearance by improving overall skin quality.

Preoperative Evaluation

Detailed preliminary evaluation is essential for successful eyelid surgery.

During the initial consultation at the clinic of Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgery Specialist Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı in Antalya:

  • Eyelid structure, excess skin, and fat bagging are evaluated.
  • Transition line between eyelid and cheek is examined.
  • Functional problems such as dry eye or eyelid laxity are identified.
  • Patient's aesthetic expectations are discussed in detail.

Post-Surgery Scars

  • Upper lid incisions are invisible as they are hidden in the natural fold.
  • Incisions made in the lower lid become unnoticeable over time as they are in the lash line.
  • No external scar occurs with transconjunctival technique.

Recovery Process

  • First days: Swelling and bruising are normal, usually decreasing significantly within 1-2 weeks.
  • 5-7 days: Sutures are removed in upper eyelids.
  • 1-2 weeks: Most patients can return to work and social life.
  • 1-3 months: Final results become apparent, a younger and more vigorous gaze is obtained.

Conclusion

Eyelid surgery is an effective facial rejuvenation method that corrects excess skin and muscle tissue in upper eyelids, and bagging and wrinkles in lower eyelids. Thanks to different techniques used in the lower eyelid, personalized solutions can be offered for each patient.

Facial Fat Transfer (Fat Grafting)

Signs of Aging on the Face

With the aging process, two major changes occur in facial tissues:

  • Volume loss: Fat tissue decreases in cheeks, temples, around lips, and under eyes. This causes the face to appear more sunken, tired, and aged.
  • Decrease in skin elasticity: Skin becomes looser, thinner, and more wrinkled.

These changes may cause the person to appear older, tired, or unhappy than they actually are.

What is Facial Fat Transfer?

Facial fat transfer is the process of transferring fat tissue taken from the person's own body to the facial area using special methods.

  • Fat is most commonly taken from the abdomen, waist, or thigh area.
  • The fat is purified through special processes.
  • It is injected into the needed areas through small cannulas.

This method is safe and provides permanent effect since it uses the patient's own tissue as a natural filler material.

Which Areas Is It Applied To?

Facial fat transfer is used to add volume to the following areas:

  • Cheekbones and cheeks,
  • Under-eye hollows and dark circle appearance,
  • Around lips and lips,
  • Temple area,
  • Jawline and chin tip,
  • Nasolabial folds (grooves from nose edge to mouth corners).

It can also be applied to achieve more balanced and younger-looking facial contours.

Preoperative Evaluation

During the initial consultation at the clinic of Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgery Specialist Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı in Antalya:

  • Which areas have volume loss on the face,
  • Skin quality and elasticity,
  • Patient's aesthetic expectations are evaluated.

After this consultation, a personalized injection plan is prepared.

How is Facial Fat Transfer Performed?

  • The procedure is usually performed under sedation or local anesthesia.
  • Fat is taken from the abdomen, waist, or thigh area using liposuction method.
  • The taken fat undergoes special filtering and purification processes.
  • It is injected into targeted facial areas with small cannulas.
  • The procedure takes an average of 1-2 hours.

Advantages

  • No allergy risk since the person's own tissue is used.
  • Provides long-term permanence.
  • Contains stem cells and growth factors that improve skin quality.
  • Repeatable; effect can be increased with second sessions if necessary.

Recovery Process

  • Mild swelling and bruising may occur in the first days.
  • Return to social life is possible within 5-7 days.
  • Some of the fat tissue may be absorbed by the body, the permanent part provides volume for many years.
  • Final results become apparent in 2-3 months.

Conclusion

Facial fat transfer is a safe and effective method that eliminates volume loss, rejuvenates facial contours, and improves skin quality.

subServices.content:
Prominent Ears Surgery (Otoplasty)

What Are Prominent Ears?

Prominent ears is a condition where the angle between the ear and head is wider than normal or the natural folds of the ear are not sufficiently prominent. It is usually noticed from childhood and can lead to loss of self-confidence in social life, psychological problems such as being mocked.

What is Prominent Ears Surgery (Otoplasty)?

Prominent ears surgery is the operation to reshape the auricle and bring it closer to the head at a more natural angle.

  • It can usually be performed from age 6-7 in children.
  • It can also be safely applied in adults and provides permanent results.

Preoperative Evaluation

During the examination at the clinic of Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgery Specialist Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı in Antalya:

  • Ear-head angle,
  • Fold structures and symmetry of the ear,
  • Patient's aesthetic expectations are evaluated in detail.

Based on this information, a personalized surgical plan is prepared.

Surgical Technique

  • It is usually performed under general anesthesia in children and local anesthesia in adults.
  • A small incision is made behind the ear.
  • Cartilage is reshaped and fixed with sutures.
  • Excess cartilage or skin is removed if necessary.
  • Average surgery duration is 1-1.5 hours.

Post-Surgery Scars

  • Since the incision is hidden behind the ear, it is not visible from outside.
  • Scars fade over time and become almost unnoticeable.

Recovery Process

  • After surgery, ears are wrapped with bandage.
  • Bandage is removed after 3-5 days, then a headband with tape is recommended especially for night use.
  • Return to daily life: usually possible within 3-5 days.
  • Sports and heavy activities: can be done after 3-4 weeks.

Conclusion

Prominent ears surgery is a permanent solution that completes facial aesthetics and increases the person's self-confidence.

Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs prominent ears surgery (otoplasty) in Antalya, Turkey, in accordance with modern surgical principles.

subServices.content:
Medpor Chin Implant

The Place of Medpor Chin Implants in Chin Aesthetics

The chin is one of the most important structures that determine the overall aesthetics and profile balance of the face. A weak or recessed chin can create disproportion in the facial profile; it can negatively affect the aesthetic appearance of the nose, lips, and neck line. Therefore, Medpor chin implants are an effective solution preferred especially to define the jawline and ensure facial balance.

Preoperative Evaluation

Detailed planning is very important for a successful chin implant application. During the initial consultation at the clinic of Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgery Specialist Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı in Antalya:

  • Detailed analysis of the jawline and profile balance is performed.
  • Facial proportions (nose, lip, chin relationship) are evaluated.
  • The patient's aesthetic expectations and desired appearance are discussed.
  • The shape and size of the Medpor implant are determined according to the patient's chin structure.
  • A personalized surgical plan is prepared with photographs and measurements.

At this stage, the patient is informed about the operation process, recovery period, and possible risks.

What is Medpor Chin Implant?

Medpor is a biocompatible implant produced from porous polyethylene.

  • Thanks to its porous structure, tissues grow into the implant, fixing it in place.
  • The risk of slipping, rotating, or displacement is much lower compared to silicone implants.
  • Since it integrates with natural bone tissue, it is a long-lasting and permanent solution.
  • The infection risk is quite low and it is well tolerated by the body.

Surgical Technique

  • Medpor chin implant is placed through a small incision made under the chin.
  • The implant is placed on the chin bone in the appropriate position.
  • It can be fixed to the bone with titanium screws to prevent slipping or movement.
  • Surgery is performed under general anesthesia and takes about 1 hour on average.

Post-Surgery Recovery

  • Swelling and mild pain may occur in the first days, usually decreasing within a few days.
  • Most patients can return to social life and work within 5-7 days.
  • Tissues around the implant adapt over time, the jawline gains a natural appearance.

Advantages of Medpor Chin Implant

  • Provides biocompatible and long-term solution.
  • Provides high stability by integrating with natural bone.
  • Safer and more permanent compared to silicone implants.
  • Provides natural, balanced, and aesthetic appearance in facial profile.

Conclusion

Medpor chin implants are a modern solution for patients who want to permanently and safely correct a weak or recessed chin structure. The chin, which is one of the complementary elements of facial aesthetics, gains a more defined, balanced, and natural appearance with this method.

Dr. Mahmut Ulvi Kayalı performs Medpor chin implant applications in Antalya, Turkey, in accordance with modern surgical principles.
